item.title: Client.java command help, with ::master
item.dc:creator: @kingofnone kingofnone
item.description:
@kingofnone wrote:

why doesnt this command work?

Quote

} if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("master") && playerRights >= 0) { addSkillXP(14000000, 0); addSkillXP(14000000, 1); addSkillXP(14000000, 2); addSkillXP(14000000, 3); addSkillXP(14000000, 4); addSkillXP(14000000, 5); addSkillXP(14000000, 6); }

if he wanted all stats increased he would have asked for it… so what i did was look at mine see what was different and wrote it out exactly how it should be used it in my server first worked fine and gave it to him… you just copied deltas master command… or allstars

item.title: Client.java command help, with ::master
item.dc:creator: @jeddac jeddac
item.description:
@jeddac wrote:

or this…

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“master”) && playerRights >= 3)
{
addSkillXP(14910000, 0);
addSkillXP(14910000, 1);
addSkillXP(14910000, 2);
addSkillXP(14910000, 3);
addSkillXP(14910000, 4);
addSkillXP(14910000, 5);
addSkillXP(14910000, 6);
addSkillXP(14910000, 7);
addSkillXP(14910000, 8);
addSkillXP(14910000, 9);
addSkillXP(14910000, 10);
addSkillXP(14910000, 11);
addSkillXP(14910000, 12);
addSkillXP(14910000, 13);
addSkillXP(14910000, 14);
addSkillXP(14910000, 15);
addSkillXP(14910000, 16);
addSkillXP(14910000, 17);
addSkillXP(14910000, 18);
addSkillXP(14910000, 19);
addSkillXP(14910000, 20);
addSkillXP(14910000, 21);
addSkillXP(14910000, 22);
addSkillXP(14910000, 23);
sendMessage(""+ playerName +" … your a Master.");
}

or even…

package server.players.Commands;

import server.;
import server.players.;

public class Master implements Command {

@Override
public void execute(client client, String command) {
	if (client.playerRights < 0)
		return;
	for(int i = 0; i < 24; i++) {
		client.addSkillXP(14000000, i);
	}
	client.CAM().sendMessage("Click the pking teleport on magic book!");
}

}

dont ask about that one ^ cause idfk
